The claim was based on a single source: the cannabis industry site Herb.co, which originally reported that the Right to Try Act could potentially make medical marijuana federally legal for terminally ill patients.
The actual bill: the Right to Try Act, did not mention marijuana specifically but focused on allowing patients with terminal illnesses to try unapproved medical products.
The bill defined an: eligible patient" as someone with diseases or conditions where the likelihood of death is high unless the course of the disease is interrupted, or with potentially fatal outcomes where the endpoint of clinical trial analysis is survival.
The details of which illnesses qualify a: threatening and the implementation of the bill would be determined on a state-by-state basis in jurisdictions that have already passed their own version of Right to Try.
